verses.verse: Now about that time Herod the king stretched out his hands to vex certain people in the church
and killed James, John's brother, with the sword.
When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he went ahead and took Peter also--those were the days of unleavened bread.
After arresting him, he put him in prison and handed him over to four quaternions of soldiers [16 soldiers] to guard him, intending after Passover to bring him out to the people.
Therefore Peter was kept in prison, but fervent prayer to God was made by the church for him.
When Herod would have brought him out, that very night, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, fastened by two chains, and the guards in front of the door guarding the prison.
Then, look, the angel of the Lord came to him and a light shown in the prison, and he tapped Peter on his side and got him up, saying, "Get up quickly," then his chains fell off his hands.
Then the angel said to him, "Get dressed and put on your sandals," and so he did. Then he said to him, "Throw your cloak around you and follow me."
So he went out and followed him, but he didn't know that what was done by the angel was real, but he thought he saw a vision.

After they were beyond the first and second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city. This opened for them all by itself, and they went through it to one street, and then the angel left him.
When Peter came to himself, he said, "Now, I truly know that the Lord has sent his angel and delivered me out of Herod's hand and all the evil hopes of the Jewish people."
After thinking about this, he came to Mary's (the mother of John whose last name was Mark) house. Many people were there praying.
Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid servant, named Rhoda, came to answer it.
When she recognized Peter's voice, she didn't open the gate because of joy but ran in and told how Peter was standing in front of the gate.
They said to her, "You're crazy," but she insisted that it was as [she said it was]. Then they said, "It is his angel."
Peter continued knocking, and after they opened it, they saw him and were in shock.

But he motioned with his hand for them to be quiet and told them how the Lord had brought him out of prison. He then said, "Go tell these things to James and the brethren," then he left for another place.
Now as soon as it was daylight, there was no small turmoil among the soldiers of what had happened to Peter.
After Herod had looked for him and didn't find him, he examined the guards and commanded they should die, then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.

Now Herod was very displeased with the people of Tyre and Sidon, so they came together to him and having made Blastus, the King's chief of his bedroom their friend; they wanted peace, because their country was supplied by the King.
Herod, on a scheduled day, was dressed in royal gowns and sitting on his throne made a speech to them.
The people shouted, "This is the voice of a god, not of a man."
Immediately the angel of the Lord fatally struck him, because he didn't give God the glory. Then he was eaten by worms and died.
But the Word of God grew and multiplied.
Then Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem after they had completely fulfilled their ministry and took with them John whose last name was Mark.
